TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ExemptionMechanism extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class provides the functionality of an exemption mechanism, examples of which are key recovery, key weakening, and key escrow.

remarks.para: This class provides the functionality of an exemption mechanism, examples of which are key recovery, key weakening, and key escrow.
Applications or applets that use an exemption mechanism may be granted stronger encryption capabilities than those which don't.
Added in 1.4.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GenExemptionBlob (output As Byte()) As Integer
public: int GenExemptionBlob(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ output);
public int GenExemptionBlob (byte[]? output);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GenExemptionBlob(unsigned int8[] output) cil managed
member this.GenExemptionBlob : byte[] -> int

Docs.summary: Generates the exemption mechanism key blob, and stores the result in the output buffer.
Docs.returns: the number of bytes stored in output

remarks.para: Generates the exemption mechanism key blob, and stores the result in the output buffer.

If the output buffer is too small to hold the result, a ShortBufferException is thrown. In this case, repeat this call with a larger output buffer. Use #getOutputSize(int) getOutputSize to determine how big the output buffer should be.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if this ExemptionMechanism instance is not initialized.
if the provided buffer is too small for the result key blob.
if error(s) occur during generation.

.method public hidebysig instance int32 GenExemptionBlob(unsigned int8[] output, int32 outputOffset) cil managed
member this.GenExemptionBlob : byte[] * int -> int

Docs.param: the offset in output where the result is stored
Docs.summary: Generates the exemption mechanism key blob, and stores the result in the output buffer, starting at outputOffset inclusive.
Docs.returns: the number of bytes stored in output

remarks.para: Generates the exemption mechanism key blob, and stores the result in the output buffer, starting at outputOffset inclusive.

If the output buffer is too small to hold the result, a ShortBufferException is thrown. In this case, repeat this call with a larger output buffer. Use #getOutputSize(int) getOutputSize to determine how big the output buffer should be.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetInstance (algorithm As String) As ExemptionMechanism
public: static Javax::Crypto::ExemptionMechanism ^ GetInstance(System::String ^ algorithm);
public static Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism? GetInstance (string? algorithm);
.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism GetInstance(string algorithm) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string -> Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism

Docs.param:
the standard name of the requested exemption mechanism. See the ExemptionMechanism section in the
Java Cryptography Architecture Standard Algorithm Name Documentation for information about standard exemption mechanism names.
Docs.summary: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

remarks.para: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

This method traverses the list of registered security Providers, starting with the most preferred Provider. A new ExemptionMechanism object encapsulating the ExemptionMechanismSpi implementation from the first Provider that supports the specified algorithm is returned.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified algorithm is not available by any provider.
if the algorithm parameter is null.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetInstance (algorithm As String, provider As Provider) As ExemptionMechanism
public: static Javax::Crypto::ExemptionMechanism ^ GetInstance(System::String ^ algorithm, Java::Security::Provider ^ provider);

.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism GetInstance(string algorithm, class Java.Security.Provider provider) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string * Java.Security.Provider -> Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism

Docs.param:
the standard name of the requested exemption mechanism. See the ExemptionMechanism section in the
Java Cryptography Architecture Standard Algorithm Name Documentation for information about standard exemption mechanism names.
Docs.summary: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

remarks.para: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

A new ExemptionMechanism object encapsulating the ExemptionMechanismSpi implementation from the specified Provider object is returned. Note that the specified Provider object does not have to be registered in the provider list.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified algorithm is not provided by the specified provider.
if the algorithm parameter is null.
if the provider parameter is null.

.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism GetInstance(string algorithm, string provider) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string * string -> Javax.Crypto.ExemptionMechanism

Docs.param:
the standard name of the requested exemption mechanism. See the ExemptionMechanism section in the
Java Cryptography Architecture Standard Algorithm Name Documentation for information about standard exemption mechanism names.
Docs.summary: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

remarks.para: Returns an ExemptionMechanism object that implements the specified exemption mechanism algorithm.

A new ExemptionMechanism object encapsulating the ExemptionMechanismSpi implementation from the specified provider is returned. The specified provider must be registered in the security provider list.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified algorithm is not provided by the specified provider.
if the specified provider is not available.
if the algorithm parameter is null.
if the provider parameter is null.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetOutputSize (inputLen As Integer) As Integer
public: int GetOutputSize(int inputLen);
public int GetOutputSize (int inputLen);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetOutputSize(int32 inputLen) cil managed
member this.GetOutputSize : int -> int

Docs.summary: Returns the length in bytes that an output buffer would need to be in order to hold the result of the next #genExemptionBlob(byte[]) genExemptionBlob operation, given the input length inputLen (in bytes).
Docs.returns: the required output buffer size (in bytes)

remarks.para: Returns the length in bytes that an output buffer would need to be in order to hold the result of the next #genExemptionBlob(byte[]) genExemptionBlob operation, given the input length inputLen (in bytes).
The actual output length of the next #genExemptionBlob(byte[]) genExemptionBlob call may be smaller than the length returned by this method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if this ExemptionMechanism instance is not initialized.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Init (key As IKey)
public: void Init(Java::Security::IKey ^ key);
public void Init (Java.Security.IKey? key);
.method public hidebysig instance void Init(class Java.Security.IKey key) cil managed
member this.Init : Java.Security.IKey -> unit

Docs.param: the key for this exemption mechanism
Docs.summary: Initializes this exemption mechanism with a key.

remarks.para: Initializes this exemption mechanism with a key.

If this exemption mechanism requires any algorithm parameters that cannot be derived from the given key, the underlying exemption mechanism implementation is supposed to generate the required parameters itself (using provider-specific default values); in the case that algorithm parameters must be specified by the caller, an InvalidKeyException is raised.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the key cannot be used to initialize this mechanism.
if error(s) occur during initialization.

member this.Init : Java.Security.IKey * Java.Security.AlgorithmParameters -> unit

Docs.param: the key for this exemption mechanism
Docs.summary: Initializes this exemption mechanism with a key and a set of algorithm parameters.

remarks.para: Initializes this exemption mechanism with a key and a set of algorithm parameters.

If this exemption mechanism requires any algorithm parameters and params is null, the underlying exemption mechanism implementation is supposed to generate the required parameters itself (using provider-specific default values); in the case that algorithm parameters must be specified by the caller, an InvalidAlgorithmParameterException is raised.

Docs.exception: if the key cannot be used to initialize this mechanism.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function IsCryptoAllowed (key As IKey) As Boolean
public: bool IsCryptoAllowed(Java::Security::IKey ^ key);
public bool IsCryptoAllowed (Java.Security.IKey? key);
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsCryptoAllowed(class Java.Security.IKey key) cil managed
member this.IsCryptoAllowed : Java.Security.IKey -> bool

Docs.param: the key the crypto is going to use.
Docs.summary: Returns whether the result blob has been generated successfully by this exemption mechanism.
Docs.returns: whether the result blob of the same key has been generated successfully by this exemption mechanism; false if key is null.

remarks.para: Returns whether the result blob has been generated successfully by this exemption mechanism.
The method also makes sure that the key passed in is the same as the one this exemption mechanism used in initializing and generating phases.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while determining whether the result blob has been generated successfully.
